frontMatter.title: Email address
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to collect email addresses from users for forms and communications.
frontMatter.intro: Use this pattern when collecting an email address, which is required for online forms that need user follow-up.

when_to_use.value: **Online form submissions.** As of October 2024, email collection is mandatory for digital submissions requiring user follow-up.
**Contact information.** When you need to communicate with users about their application or request.

design_principles.value: **Collect for both parties when applicable.** Capture email for both the Veteran and form completer if they are different individuals.
**Leverage existing data.** Pre-populate email address from VA Profile API whenever possible.
**Skip confirmation fields.** Avoid 'confirm email' fields as they provide minimal error-catching benefit when users copy/paste.
**Validate in real-time.** Validate formatting upon entry to catch mistakes immediately.
**Be transparent about data use.** Tell people why you want their email address to build trust.
**Pair with phone number.** Email typically appears alongside phone number collection on the same form step.
**Use prefill notification.** Use the prefill component to inform users when profile data populates fields.

examples.title: Email address field
examples.description: Standard email input with validation and helpful error messaging.

examples.title: Email with context
examples.description: Email field with explanation of how the address will be used.

how_to_build.intro: The email pattern uses a text input with email-specific validation.

steps.value: Use a single text input field with type='email' for browser validation.
Include context about why the email is needed and how it will be used.
Validate format on entry and provide immediate feedback.
Pre-populate from VA Profile when available.

frontMatter.code_usage:
The `emailPattern` is available as a web-component pattern in the VA Forms library.

```jsx
import { emailPattern } from '@department-of-veterans-affairs/platform-forms-system/patterns';
```

See the [vets-website repository](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/vets-website) for implementation details.

content_considerations.value: Include context explaining why email is needed: 'We may use your contact information to contact you if we have questions about your application.'
Don't use jargon or technical terms when describing email requirements.

content_specs.error_message: Enter a valid email address without spaces using this format: email@domain.com
You entered a character we can't accept. Try removing the character.

accessibility.value: Ensure the email field has a visible, associated label.
Use autocomplete='email' to help users fill in the field.
Provide clear error messages that explain the expected format.
Validate during entry and announce errors to screen readers.
